reviews.review_msg: One of the most well-organized remote classes that I've taken! Her lectures are clear and straightforward rather than 2-3 hours of fluff. It felt like Meg tried really hard to lessen the stress on us during this time and I really enjoyed this class! It does take a lot of work to do well, but textbook is free!

Meg is a solid prof! Her lectures are quite good, and I love the textbook she uses for this course - it is so helpful! This class definitely needs a lot of practice and application of the things you learn in class in order to get a good mark, but if you practice, it is very doable. Her assignments are helpful for practice on the test.

Meg is a good professor. The online textbook that she uses (for free) is very well written, and serves as an excellent resource. Her lectures are great some weeks, and more confusing on others. She gives multiple assignments and tests with no midterm/final so the grades are a fairly balanced representation. This course gets progressively harder

I don't get why she gets a bad rating for other classes but from my personal experience, she runs one of the most efficiently structured online classes, despite the challenging times. She returns homework feedback before tests so it really helps to learn from mistakes. Her lectures are concise and clear and help with hw a lot. Tests are very fair

Margaret isn't a good teacher, even though she boasts of all her experience. She teaches mainly theory, not application, and then doesn't understand why people can't do the work. Her tests are very difficult and a little bit outrageous at times. She can be very passive aggressive as well. Beware.

Her exams are laughably easy, and assignments are quite easy as well. The course is interesting, but she is so slow and that kills all the anticipation. Ended up skipping some of her lectures because of the slow pacing, but it's not a problem - everything's up on Canvas and do attend the tutorials! Otherwise she is fine, no complaints.
Class is too time-consuming and stressful
